The International School of Moscow
Dear Parents,
I want to ensure that you are aware of the important dates ahead in this term so that you do not miss any important events.
November
Thursday 3rd and 10th: Parent teacher Consultations Years 1-9 (4-6pm)
Monday 7th: 3S and 7A Class Assemblies. Parents from those classes welcome
Tuesday/ Wednesday 8th and 9th: Last weeks of After School Activities for Term One
Monday 14th: 3D and 7B Class Assemblies. Parents from those classes welcome
Friday 18th: Foundation Stage Initial Reports sent home
Monday 21st: 3C Class Assembly. Parents from 3C welcome
Tuesday 29th: Y1 Production 9:30 am
Wednesday 30th: Y4 Production 9:30 am Y1 Production 6:00 pm
December
Thursday 1st : Y4 Production 6:00 pm
Friday 9th Year 6- 9 End of Term One Reports sent home
Friday 9th Christmas celebrations – Whole School. Class reps will confirm details
Tuesday 14th: Christmas Carol Concert 6:00 pm. All ISM families are welcome
Please ensure that these dates are in your diary and I hope to see you soon at one or more of these events.
Information Update
Pick –Up and Drop Off Times
We are continuing to work hard on systems to improve drop- off procedures and pick up procedures. Obviously the volume of traffic does make this a challenge but we are committed to seeking solutions.
As laid out in the handbook children should arrive no earlier than 15 minutes before registration each morning. (8:10 0n Upper Campus and 8:15 on Lower Campus) Please understand that all academic staff are busy before this time attending meetings or planning and preparing lessons for the day.
Similarly children should be collected promptly after school at the end of the day. (3:15 on Lower Campus and 3:30 on Upper Campus) Youngsters can get upset if parents are late and are waiting for long periods after a busy day. Your understanding and support is appreciated on these issues.
Healthy Snacks
We have been working hard to improve school lunches while maintaining a balanced diet. Zarina has been doing great work in that department, consulting with students and teachers in a series of “taste-tests”. The children have responded positively and have been eating very well this term.
As a school we try very hard to encourage children to eat healthily. (The odd exceptions being birthday lollypops and special events) We would like to encourage children to bring healthy snacks to school to support this ethos.
In particular we would ask that wherever possible processed foods with high sugar and/or salt contents are avoided. Fresh fruit and vegetables are great choices as are homemade products.
Studies suggest that healthy, nutritious food is crucial in helping people perform at their best. This is particularly true for youngsters. We have observed of late more sweets and chocolates on the school premises. Please help us in teaching the children to make healthy choices and as a consequence perform better both in and out of school.
Baker Book Club: Lower Campus
We have been able to extend the deadline for purchasing books to Monday 7th November, giving families an extra weekend to look at the catalogues provided. If you wish to take advantage of this opportunity, please make sure that your orders reach school by that date with the exact amount of money in a sealed envelope.
